column5: Thanks to everyone who commented. Sending love to you all!

I have been flirting with the option of treatment for years but after descending into a pretty bad relapse this past year, I plan to make recovery a reality. Even though the other half of me doesnâ€™t really feel worthy of it or want it because Iâ€™m still not thin enough. I still feel like I need to lose more weight in order to warrant getting treatment, even though Iâ€™m underweight right now and feel tired, dissociated and weak all of the time. 
Anyway, Iâ€™m sorry youâ€™re in this position and are not receiving the mental support you need. Itâ€™s not your fault. I really empathize with feeling guilty, itâ€™s so hard not to feel it. I feel like itâ€™s part and parcel with this disease. 
Sending you love.

Iâ€™m in this exact situation but we have been together for 5 1/2 years and live together with our dog. I hadnâ€™t planned on purging but I still did, like a couple hours after dinner bc I couldnâ€™t digest it and couldnâ€™t stand the feeling of fullness any longer. 
I have a really bad head cold from my immune system being low and I know thatâ€™s my own fault. As soon as I got out of the bathroom my mom was like â€œdid you throw up?â€ 
Like WTF. I said â€œnoâ€ and gave her a weird look. She was aware of my head cold but I wasnâ€™t sick from flu or anything so it seemed strange that she would ask that. 
Youâ€™d think if she was actually concerned she wouldnâ€™t say it so nonchalantly. 
One more Christmas dinner left and then itâ€™ll be over. Sending everyone love! We can get through this.
Best book ever. Didnâ€™t have time to read it fast enough before having to bring it back to the library! Gotta get a copy one of these days.

Fear and denial and not feeling â€œsick enoughâ€ wreak such havoc on oneâ€™s overall cognition. Thanks for the encouragement.

And while I want to stay alive for my partner and my dog, itâ€™s also just so hard to truly care about it sometimes. Life is so exhausting. I appreciate you all so much. â¤ï¸

Thanks for all the encouragement folks! And yes Iâ€™ve brought him to many training classes already, the breeder we got him from is a dog trainer and we see her frequently. 
It is a matter of being consistent myself, which can be difficult. And of course working on my patience. I hope it will improve as he gets older.

After 6 months going NC with her I reconnected with her, sat down and explained why I had to go no contact, how painful yet necessary it was, and set some boundaries with her. She listened, seemed understanding and somewhat sympathetic. There were a lot of tears. She said â€œI donâ€™t know how to be a mom or a friend. But I want to learn how.â€ It felt healing and hopeful in the moment. 
Fast forward 5 months later and we arenâ€™t speaking again due to her manipulation, guilt and mind fuckery. She still treats me like a child, calls me â€œbabyâ€, tries to invade my space any way she can. (Iâ€™ve also regressed w my boundaries bc itâ€™s almost impossible not to if I want to have her in my life in any capacity, which I feel really guilty and like a failure for.) Iâ€™m also the eldest and only daughter so she really punishes me a lot and treats me differently than my brothers. 
My brother is setting boundaries with her today and I sent him this thread to read. Sometimes it just feels like itâ€™s all a lost cause and Iâ€™m sick of feeling depressed and at a loss all bc I canâ€™t have the mother I need. Itâ€™s tiring and I feel like Iâ€™m too old for this. 
Thank you for this thread!

I feel the exact same way! I havenâ€™t even spoken about my ed to my parents in years, let alone can relate to having parents actually take interest in my declining health. In my mid-late twenties rn and life is so lonely living with ED and not having anyone really notice or care. Nice to come to this community and feel less alone!
Yes and major depression and anxiety disorder

In a toxic relationship with the mirror. It seduces and controls my every waking moment. Always searching for the skeleton underneath my skin. I canâ€™t remember a time when I wasnâ€™t trying to disappear.
Always sad. Trying to control the sadness. Tired from smiling. Making plans then immediately dreading having to go through with them. Cancelling them. Sleeping too much. Sleeping too little. Over caffeinated. Unmotivated. 
Less is more and more is less. Scared of people. Endlessly exhausted. Desperate to appear lively and lovely. Deviating from the path to reality.
